title: Can't install...Visual C++ error 1935. Can't uninstall previous C++version. Updated Windows 10.
body:
Problem in post title.

I can't install the client. I get a visual C++ error. 

There is no previous C++ version to uninstall. I am fully updated with Windows.

replies.body: It's strange that the product is missing despite an OS update, but no worries.  Trying manually downloading the package [here](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=3387), which should allow you to complete the installation.  Hope that helps!

Also, I believe the title of my post is misleading. 

I never installed it in the first place.

What I should have said is "no previous version to uninstall" as it was never installed in the first place.

Hey man thanks for the fast response.

I have already tried manually installing the package. Alas, to no success.

I even installed some kind of 2010 and 2015 Visual C++ package hoping they would somehow override it. 

But still no dice. I get the same 1935 error.

https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/1059423-setup-failed-to-install-microsoft-visual-c--2005-redistributable

Try this if you havent already

edit: another fix http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-windows_programs/microsoft-visual-c-2005-redistributable-error-1935/9b245369-5053-e011-8dfc-68b599b31bf5?auth=1

Please becareful when editing the registry... (the second fix) as if you edit the wrong thing or place a wrong value BAD things can happen.  If you follow the steps word for word it should all be good

> [{quoted}](name=WuTuStronk,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1QgWghc9,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-09-24T23:42:04.169+0000)
>
> https://success.trendmicro.com/solution/1059423-setup-failed-to-install-microsoft-visual-c--2005-redistributable
> 
> Try this if you havent already
> 
> edit: another fix http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-windows_programs/microsoft-visual-c-2005-redistributable-error-1935/9b245369-5053-e011-8dfc-68b599b31bf5?auth=1
> 
> Please becareful when editing the registry... (the second fix) as if you edit the wrong thing or place a wrong value BAD things can happen.  If you follow the steps word for word it should all be good

Thanks for the help man

It actually resolved itself

Even though windows didnt tell me, i had two more restarts left to fully finish my windows updates
